answers.answer: Try going back to the clinic. Ask them about your results.Sometimes they forget to call people back. Did you do a fasting test? Or was it random?Have you tried taking several small meals a day instead of 1 - 3 meals a day?Have you had your ears checked? Your sinuses? These can both cause those feelings as well.Don't give up hope!You could always buy a test kit at a drugstore and check for yourself as well.Good luck!

thanks for a reply when u say test kit probably u mean kit for checking diabetes. I will definitely do that.. thanks.. and yes it was blood check on empty stomach but results came for my raised cholesterol that was 5.5 they were advising me healthy eating diet and nothing else..

question: I am 41 male living in London and getting dizzy when driving around two hours I was getting lessons for driving test and now I am little confused don't know what to do cause I got this symptom for awhile and don't know is it worth to even try to carry on cause what kind of a driver will I become if I can't drive more than two hours, who will give me a job? this really makes me sad.. I noticed the same symptom if I work long hours like more than 8 hours a day but with the driving it comes much quicker.. I guess it has something to do with the sugar in blood but recently I have done blood test through my GP practice and nobody told me that I had a diabetes or something like this.. I have done blood test for sugar last year with different practice as well but nobody contacted me then either. I would b delighted if somebody can explain my problem really thanks..
title: dizziness while driving
